functionality package¶

functionality module¶

class src.functionality.functionality.Functionality¶

Bases: ABC

Abstract base class for all modules that perform some functionality on the emulator.

This class defines the common interface for all functionality modules. Subclasses must implement the perform method, which carries out the specific functionality. Additionally, when performing an action, it is essential to set the action_time in the toolbox.

Attributes:

None

Methods:
perform(): Abstract method to be implemented by subclasses. Performs the specific functionality.

Must set the action_time in the toolbox. :returns: None :rtype: None

abstract perform()¶

player module¶

This code is an excerpt from “adb-event-record” by Tzutalin. (https://github.com/tzutalin/adb-event-record) The excerpt was modified to fit the needs of this project

class src.functionality.player.Player¶

Bases: Functionality

Represents a player functionality for performing actions.

This class handles replaying actions based on recorded data.

Variables:

  • STORE_LINE_RE – Regular expression pattern for parsing stored data lines.

  • logger – Logger instance for logging messages related to player functionality.

STORE_LINE_RE = re.compile('(\\S+) (\\S+) (\\S+) (\\S+) (\\S+)$')¶
logger = 'player'¶
perform()¶

Perform the player action.

This method replays recorded actions based on stored data.

This code is an excerpt from “adb-event-record” by Tzutalin. (https://github.com/tzutalin/adb-event-record) The excerpt was modified to fit the needs of this project

class src.functionality.recorder.Recorder¶

Bases: Functionality

Represents a recorder functionality for capturing events.

This class handles recording events based on input data.

Variables:

EVENT_LINE_RE – Regular expression pattern for parsing event lines.

EVENT_LINE_RE = re.compile('(\\S+): (\\S+) (\\S+) (\\S+)$')¶
perform()¶

This method captures events and writes them to a file.

write_dummy_event()¶

Write a dummy event to the output file.

write_event(dev, etype, ecode, data)¶

Write an input event to the output file.

Parameters:

  • dev (str) – Device identifier.

  • etype (str) – Event type.

  • ecode (str) – Event code.

  • data (str) – Event data.

screenshot module¶

class src.functionality.screenshot.Screenshot¶

Bases: Functionality

This class provides functionality for capturing screenshots.

Methods:

  • perform(): Starts the screenshot thread.

  • set_action(): Sets the current screenshot action.

  • get_action(): Retrieves the current screenshot action.

  • screenshot_thread(): Captures screenshots at regular intervals.

  • stop(): Stops the screenshot thread.

  • generate_name(): Generates a unique screenshot filename.

actions = <queue.Queue object>¶
finished = False¶
generate_name()¶

Generate a unique screenshot filename.

Returns:

The generated screenshot filename.

Return type:

str

get_action()¶

Retrieve the current screenshot action.

Returns:

The current screenshot action.

Return type:

str

perform()¶

Start the screenshot thread.

screenshot_thread()¶

Capture screenshots at regular intervals. Meant to be run as a Thread.

set_action(action)¶

Set the current screenshot action.

Parameters:

action (Anything that can reasonably be converted to a String) – The screenshot action.

stop()¶

Stop the screenshot thread.

trigdroid module¶

class src.functionality.trigdroid.Trigdroid¶

Bases: Functionality

Wrapper for the Trigdroid Tool to integrate it into Sandroid

Attributes:

logger (Logger): Logger instance for Trigdroid. did_dummy_round (bool): Indicates if a dummy round was performed. override_package_name (str): Name of the overridden package. package_name_overridden (bool): Indicates if the package name was overridden.

did_dummy_round = True¶
logger = 'trigdroid'¶
overide_package(new_name)¶

Overrides the package name with a new name.

Parameters:

new_name (str) – The new package name.

override_package_name = ''¶
package_name_overridden = False¶
perform()¶

Executes the main functionality of Trigdroid.

run_ccf()¶

Runs the Trigdroid CCF utility.

run_trigdroid(package_name)¶

Runs the Trigdroid with the specified package name.

Warning

Always uses the default config file (“config.yml”) which should be in the root folder where sandroid is run

Parameters:

package_name (str) – The name of the package to be tested.
